text: The Messenger of Allah (saw) said: Whoever forgets a prayer, let him pray it when he remembers it.
The Prophet said, "All drinks that produce intoxication are Haram (forbidden to drink).
Whenever the Prophet got up at night, he used to clean his mouth with Siwak.
Allah's Apostle said, "If anyone of you enters a mosque, he should pray two Rakat before sitting."
Allah's Apostle said, "Whenever you hear the Adhan, say what the Muadhin is saying.
The Prophet said, "If supper is served, and Iqama is pronounced one should start with the supper."
The Prophet used to pray a short prayer (in congregation) but used to offer it in a perfect manner.
The Prophet said, "Straighten your rows or Allah will alter your faces."
Allah's Apostle said, "Whoever does not recite Al-Fatiha in his prayer, his prayer is invalid."
Allah's Apostle (p.b.u.h) said, "Anyone of you attending the Friday (prayers) should take a bath."
Whenever Allah's Apostle saw the rain, he used to say, "O Allah! Let it be a strong fruitful rain."
Whenever the Prophet got up for Tahajjud prayer he used to clean his mouth (and teeth) with Siwak.
The Prophet used to lie down on his right side, after offering two Rakat (Sunna) of the Fajr prayer.
Allah's Apostle said, "Offer some of your prayers in your houses and do not make them graves."
Allah's Apostle said, "Between my house and the pulpit there is a garden of the gardens of Paradise."
The Prophet said, "The real patience is at the first stroke of a calamity."
The Prophet ordered the people to pay Zakat-ul-Fitr before going to the Eid prayer.
The Prophet said, "O Allah! Bestow on Medina twice the blessings You bestowed on Makkah."
Allah's Apostle said, "When Ramadan begins, the gates of Paradise are opened."
Allah's Apostle used to practise Itikaf in the last ten days of the month of Ramadan.
The Prophet (SAW) said, "Az-Zulm (Oppression) will be a darkness on the Day of Resurrection."
Allah's Messenger used to accept gifts and used to give something in return.
The Prophet (SAW) said, "He who takes back his present is like him who swallows his vomit."
The Prophet (SAW) said, "Plague is the cause of martyrdom of every Muslim (who dies because of it)."
The Prophet said, "None of you will have faith till he wishes for his (Muslim) brother what he likes for himself."
The Prophet said "None of you will have faith till he loves me more than his father, his children and all mankind."
Allah's Apostle said, 'Whoever prays the two cool prayers ('Asr and Fajr) will go to Paradise.'
The Prophet said, "The prayer in congregation is twenty-five times superior to the prayer offered by person alone."
The Prophet (saw) said to Abu-Dhar, "Listen and obey (your chief) even if he is an Ethiopian with a head like a raisin."
Allah's Apostle said, "You will be rewarded for whatever you spend for Allah's sake even if it were a morsel which you put in your wife's mouth."
The Prophet said, "If anyone of you feels drowsy while praying, he should sleep till he understands what he is saying (reciting)."
The Prophet said, "Straighten your rows as the straightening of rows is essential for a perfect and correct prayer."
Allah's Apostle said, "One prayer in my Mosque is better than one thousand prayers in any other mosque except Al-Masjid-AI-Haram."
The Prophet (p.b.u.h) said, "The best charity is that which is practiced by a wealthy person. And start giving first to your dependents."
The Prophet said to me, "Do not withhold your money, (for if you did so) Allah would with-hold His blessings from you."
Allah's Apostle said, "There are angels guarding the entrances (or roads) of Medina, neither plague nor Ad-Dajjal will be able to enter it."
Allah's Apostle said, "The people will remain on the right path as long as they hasten the breaking of the fast."
The Prophet said, "A time will come when one will not care how one gains one's money, legally or illegally."
Allah's Apostle said, "May Allah's mercy be on him who is lenient in his buying, selling, and in demanding back his money."
The Apostle of Allah (may peace be upon him) used to remember Allah at all moments.
Bilal was commanded (by the Holy Prophet) to repeat the phrases twice in Adhan, and once in lqama.
The Prophet (pbuh) said: Iman has over seventy branches, and modesty is a branch of Iman.
The Apostle (pbuh) observed: When a man calls his brother an unbeliever, it returns (at least) to one of them.
The Apostle of Allah observed: The best of' the deeds or deed is the (observance of) prayer at its proper time and kindness to the parents.
The Apostle of Allah (pbuh) observed: He who as in his heart the weight of a mustard seed of pride shall not enter Paradise.
The Messenger of Allah (may peace be upon him) said: The Hour (Resurrection) would not come upon anyone so long as he supplicates Allah.
The Messenger of Allah (pbuh) loved to start from the right-hand side for performing ablution, for combing (the hair) and wearing the shoes.
The Messenger of Allah (may peace be upon him) said: When the Muadhin calls to prayer, Satan runs back vehemently.
The earth has been made for me purifying and as a mosque (place for prayer).
The supplication made between the adhan and the iqamah is not rejected.
Let the best among you call the adhan for you, and the Quran-readers act as your imams.
The Prophet (p.b.u.h) said: The best of you are those whose shoulders are soft in prayer.
The Prophet (p.b.u.h) said: Have the imam in the centre and close up the gaps.
Your mouths are the paths of the Quran, so perfume them with the tooth stick
The Messenger of Allah (saw) used to remember Allah in all circumstances.
The Messenger of Allah (saw) used to make his prayer brief but perfect.
The Messenger of Allah (saw) said: "Beautify the Quran with your voices."
The Messenger of Allah (saw) said: 'Patience should come with the first shock."
The Messenger of Allah (saw) said: "Eat Suhur, for in Suhur there is a blessing."
The Messenger of Allah (saw) forbade fasting on the Day of Fitr and the Day of Adha.
The Prophet (saw) said: "A grateful eater is equal to a patient fasting person."
The Messenger of Allah (saw) said: "The best of you are those who are best to their womenfolk."
The Messenger of Allah (saw) said: "The most hated of permissible things to Allah is divorce."
The Messenger of Allah (saw) said: 'Do not take oaths by idols nor by your forefathers."
The Messenger of Allah (saw) said: "An oath (leads to) either sin or regret."
The Messenger of Allah (saw) said: "Your oath is as your companion understands it to be."
The Messenger of Allah (saw) said: "Whoever achieves at something, let him stick with It."
The Messenger of Allah (saw) said: "No one hoards but a sinner."
The Messenger of Allah (saw) said: "When you weigh, allow more."
The Prophet (saw) said: "O Allah, bless my nation in their early mornings."
The Messenger of Allah (saw) said: "Do not take back your charity."
The Messenger of Allah (saw) said: "Give the worker his wages before his sweat dries."
The Messenger of Allah (saw) said: 'Do Wudu properly.'
The Messenger of Allah (saw) said: Whoever is in the Masjid waiting for the prayer, he is in a state of prayer.
The Prophet (saw) said: One of the portents of the Hour will be that people will show off in building Masjids.

Abu Bakr Raḍiyallāhu 'anhu narrates that Rasulullah Ṣallallāhu 'alaihi wasallam said: He who accepts from me the Kalimah, which I presented to my uncle (Abu Talib at the time of his death) and he rejected it, this will be a means for his salvation
Umar Raḍiyallāhu 'anhu narrates Nabī Ṣallallahu 'alaihi wasallam said: O son of Khaṭṭāb! Go and announce amongst the people that indeed none shall enter Paradise except the Mu'minūn (believers)

Abu Laila Radiyallahu anhu narrates that Nabi Sallallahu alaihi wasallam said: Woe to you O Abu Sufyan! Indeed I have come to you with (the success of) this world and the Hereafter, so accept Islām, and enter into safety

Anas ibne-Malik Radiyallahu anhu narrates that Rasulullah Şallallahu 'alaihi wasallam said: Good tidings to the one who has believed in me and seen me; and good tidings seven times over to the one who has believed in me and has not seen me

Amr ibne-'Abasah Raḍiyallahu 'anhu asked: Which Iman is the best? Nabi Şallallahu 'alaihi wasallam replied: Hijra (generally it means migration). And then asked: What is Hijra? Nabi Sallallahu 'alaihi wasallam replied: To forsake evil

Uthman ibne-'Affan Raḍiyallāhu 'anhu narrates that Rasulullāh Şallallahu 'alaihi wasallam said: He, who died knowing (and believing) that there is none worthy of worship except Allāh, will enter Paradise
Uthman ibne-'Affan Radiyallāhu 'anhu narrates that Rasulullāh Şallallahu 'alaihi wasallam said: He, who died knowing that Allah is True and He exists, will enter Paradise
Ubadah ibne-Ṣāmit Raḍiyallāhu 'anhu said: I heard Rasulullāh Şallallahu 'alaihi wasallam saying: He who died not ascribing any partner to Allāh, Allāh indeed forbids the Fire upon him
reference: Amalul Yaumi wal Lailah lin Nasaĩ

text: Nawwās ibne-Sam'ān Raḍiyallāhu 'anhu narrates that he heard Nabi Şallallahu 'alaihi wasallam saying: He who dies, not ascribing any partner to Allāh, indeed, forgiveness becomes incumbent for him

Abu Hurairah Raḍiyallahu 'anhu narrates that Nabī Ṣallallāhu 'alaihi wasallam said: Iman is that you believe in Allah, and His angels, and meeting Him (in the Hereafter), and His Messengers, and that you believe in the Resurrection

Umar ibnil-Khaṭṭāb Radiyallahu 'anhu narrates that he heard Nabi Şallallahu 'alaihi wasallam saying: He who dies believing in Allāh, and the Last Day, it will be said to him: Enter from any of the eight doors of Paradise that you wish

Abu Hurairah Raḍiyallāhu 'anhu reported that Nabi Sallallahu 'alaihi wasallam in a Ḥadīth Qudsi said: When Allah had created the creation, He wrote in His Book which is with Him above the Throne: Indeed My Mercy prevails over My Anger
Abu Hurairah Raḍiyallāhu 'anhu narrates that Nabī Șallallāhu 'alaihi wasallam said: He who holds fast to my Sunnah during the time of corruption in my Ummah, for him is the reward of a Martyr

Irbāḍ ibne-Sariyah Raḍiyallahu 'anhu, the companion of Rasulullah Sallallahu 'alaihi wasallam narrates: I heard Rasulullah Şallallahu 'alaihi wasallam saying: Verily I am the slave of Allāh and the seal of prophets
Abdullah ibne-'Amr Raḍiyallāhu 'anhuma narrates that Nabī Şallallahu 'alaihi wasallam said: No person is a true believer until he believes that destiny, good and bad, is from Allāh
Abdullah ibne-'Umar Raḍiyallahu 'anhuma narrates that Rasulullah Şallallahu 'alaihi wasallam said: Every thing is destined, even mental weakness and intelligence

Ibne-'Abbās Raḍiyallahu 'anhuma narrates that Abu Bakr Radiyallahu 'anhu said: O Rasulallah! Indeed you have aged! He replied: (The Sūrah) Hūd, Al-Waqi'ah, Al-Mursalāt, 'Amma Yata Sā'alun, and Idhash Shamsu Kuwwirat have aged me
Abdullāh Raḍiyallahu 'anhu narrates that Nabī Ṣallallāhu 'alaihi wasallam said: The Last Hour will come only upon the most wicked people
Anas ibne-Malik Raḍiyallāhu 'anhu narrates that Rasulullāh Şallallahu 'alaihi wasallam said: My intercession will be for those of my Ummah who have committed major sins
Sahl ibne-Sa'd Al Sa'īdī Raḍiyallāhu 'anhu narrates that Rasulullah Şallallāhu 'alaihi wasallam said: The space that a whip occupies in Paradise is better than the world and what it contains
Faḍālah ibne-'Ubaid Radiyallahu 'anhu narrates that Nabi Şallallahu 'alaihi wasallam said: The Mujahid (one striving in the Path of Allah) is he who fights against his personal desires
Abu Hurairah Raḍiyallahu 'anhu narrates that Rasulullāh Şallallahu 'alaihi wasallam said: The world is a believer's prison, and an unbeliever's Paradise

Abu Hurairah Raḍiyallāhu 'anhu narrates that Nabī Ṣallallāhu 'alaihi wasallam said: Anyone of you who leaves his home to come to my masjid, for every footstep a virtue is written, and for every other footstep a sin is erased, until he returns
Jabir ibne-'Abdullah Raḍiyallahu 'anhuma narrates that Nabī Şallallahu 'alaihi wasallam said: The key to Paradise is Șalat and the key to Ṣalāt is Wuḍū
Anas Radiyallāhu 'anhu narrates that Rasulullāh Şallallāhu 'alaihi wasallam said: The comfort and delight of my eyes has been placed in Şalāt
Umar Radiyallahu 'anhu narrates that Rasulullah Şallallāhu 'alaihi wasallam said: Salat is a pillar of Deen
Uthman ibne-'Affān Raḍiyallāhu 'anhu narrates that Rasūlullāh Şallallahu 'alaihi wasallam said: He who believes that Ṣalāt is the obligatory right (of Allāh) will enter Paradise
reference: Musnad Aḥmad, Abu Ya'lā, Bazzar, Majma'uz-Zawāid

text: Abu Hurairah Raḍiyallahu 'anhu narrates that Rasulullah Şallallahu 'alaihi wasallam said: He who guards the obligatory Șalāt will not be written amongst the neglectful
Abu Mālik Al Ashja'ī narrates from his father Raḍiyallahu 'anhuma, who said that whenever a man accepted Islām during the time of Nabi Şallallāhu 'alaihi wasallam, the Sahābah used to teach him Şalāt
Hasan ibne-'Alī Raḍiyallahu 'anhuma narrates that Rasulullāh Şallallahu 'alaihi wasallam said: He who recites Ayatul Kursi after obligatory Șalāt, is in the protection of Allah till the next Ṣalāt
Umme Farwah Raḍiyallāhu 'anhā narrates that Rasulullāh Şallallahu 'alaihi wasallam was asked: Which is the best of the good deeds? He said: To offer Şalāt at the beginning of its prescribed time
Ali Radiyallāhu 'anhu narrates that Rasulullah Şallallahu 'alaihi wasallam said: O People of the Qur'an! Offer Witr Şalāt, for verily Allāh is Witr, and He loves the Witr
Jabir ibne-Abdullah Radiyallahu 'anhuma narrates: I heard Rasulullah Şallallahu 'alaihi wasallam saying: Between man and (his entering into) polytheism and unbelief is the abandonment of Salāt
Ibne-'Abbās Raḍiyallahu 'anhuma narrates that Rasulullāh Şallallahu 'alaihi wasallam said: He who abandons Şalat shall meet Allāh in a state that Allah will be very angry with him
Naufal ibne-Mu'awiya Raḍiyallahu 'anhu narrates that Nabī Sallallahu 'alaihi wasallam said: The person who missed even one Șalāt is as though he has been deprived of his entire family and wealth

Sahl ibne-Sa'd Raḍiyallahu 'anhu narrates that Rasulullah Ṣallallahu 'alaihi wasallam said: Two things are never rejected or seldom rejected; Du'a at the time of Ādhān and at the time when people are locked in a furious battle
Sa'd ibne-Abi Waqqas Radiyallahu anhu narrates that Rasulullah Şallallahu 'alaihi wasallam said: The one who hears the Muadhdhin and responds with (the following), his sins will be forgiven
Jābir Radiyallahu 'anhu narrates that Rasulullah Sallallāhu 'alaihi wasallam said: When the Iqamah for Ṣalāt is being said, the doors of the skies are opened, and Du'ā is accepted
Abu Hurairah Radiyallahu 'anhu narrates that Rasulullāh Şallallahu 'alaihi wasallam said: Those who frequent the masjids in darkness, undoubtedly are the people who are immersed in Allah's Mercy
Buraidah Raḍiyallahu 'anhu narrates that Nabī Ṣallallāhu 'alaihi wasallam said: Good tidings for those who frequent the masjids in darkness, of complete Nür (light) on the Day of Resurrection
Irbädh ibne-Sariyah Raḍiyallāhu 'anhu narrates that Rasulullāh Ṣallallahu 'alaihi wasallam used to pray for forgiveness three times for the first row and once for the second row
A'ishah Radhiallāhū 'anhã narrates that Rasulullah Şallallāhu 'alaihi wasallam said: Verily Allah sends Mercy and His angels invoke blessings for those who fill in the gaps to complete the rows
Abu Hurairah Raḍiyallahu 'anhu narrates that Rasulullah Şallallahu 'alaihi wasallam said: Whoever joins a row (of Ṣalāt), Allah raises him one rank; and the angels shower (Allāh's) blessings upon him
Abu Juḥaifah Raḍiyallāhu 'anhu narrates that Nabī Ṣallallāhu 'alaihi wasallam said: He who fills the gap in a row (of Ṣalāt) is forgiven
Anas Raḍiyallahu 'anhu narrates that Nabī Ṣallallahu 'alaihi wasallam said: Straighten your rows, for the straightening of the rows in Salāt is essential for the offering of Șalāt correctly
Umar ibnil Khattab Radiyallahu anhu narrates: I heard Rasulullah Şallallahu 'alaihi wasallam saying: Allah Subḥānahu wa Ta'ālā indeed admires the people offering Șalat in congregation

Abdullah ibne-Mas'ud Raḍiyallāhu 'anhu narrates that Rasulullah Şallallahu 'alaihi wasallam said: The excellence of a person's Șalāt in congregation is even greater than twenty times as compared to his individual Ṣalāt

Abu Hurairah Raḍiyallahu 'anhu narrates that Rasulullāh Şallallahu 'alaihi wasallam said: The reward of Șalāt offered by a person in congregation is twenty five times greater as compared to that Ṣalat offered by him alone in his house or place of business

Abu Hurairah Raḍiyallahu 'anhu narrates that Rasulullāh Şallallahu 'alaihi wasallam said once on a Friday: O Community of Muslims! Allah has made this day an 'Eid for you, so take a bath and heedfully brush your teeth with Siwak (toothstick)
Abu Umāmah Raḍiyallahu 'anhu narrates that Rasulullāh Şallallahu 'alaihi wasallam said: Indeed the bath, taken on Friday, removes sins even to the extent of removing them from the roots of the hair
